title: The Pandemic Bounceback Abroad: Concerts And Movies In Other Countries
description:
While U.S. movie theaters continue to struggle, the picture is better for the international box office. NPR's Bob Mondello, who's reported on how domestic theaters are getting by, explains why things look more promising abroad.

A recent outbreak of the coronavirus in the Chinese city of Qingdao says a lot about how aggressively the country has adopted public health measures. Those measures have led to a return of some music festivals, as NPR's Emily Feng reports.

In participating regions, you'll also hear a local news segment that will help you make sense of what's going on in your community.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

itunes:title: The Pandemic Bounceback Abroad: Concerts And Movies In Other Countries
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Movies theaters are doing better internationally than in the U.S. And with the coronavirus spread under control in China, the country is once again holding music festivals.
itunes:subtitle: Movies theaters are doing better internationally than in the U.S. And with the coronavirus spread under control in China, the country is once again holding music festivals.
